com.vernalis.knime.mmp

Class FragmentKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.knime.mmp.FragmentKey
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<FragmentKey>

    public class FragmentKey
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<FragmentKey>
    A simple class to hold the fragment key as an ArrayList, which is then sorted and concatenated to a multicomponent SMILES
    Author:
    "Stephen Roughley "

    • Method Detail

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(java.lang.String smiles)
        Method to add a component as its SMILES string to the key. Multi-component SMILES will be split and added correctly
        Parameters:
        smiles - The SMILES string to add

      • mergeKeys

        public void mergeKeys(FragmentKey otherKey)
        Method to add all the components from a second key to this key
        Parameters:
        otherKey - A second FragmentKey

      • getNumComponents

        public int getNumComponents()
        Method to return the number of components in the Key object

      • getKeyAsString

        public java.lang.String getKeyAsString(boolean removeExplicitHs)
        Method to get the key as a concatenated multi-component SMILES string, sorted in reverse natural order of components. NB, the SMILES components themselves are not canonicalised
        Parameters:
        Remove - Explicit H atoms?

      • getKeyAsDataCell

        public org.knime.core.data.DataCell getKeyAsDataCell(boolean removeExplicitHs)
        Returns a SmilesCell representation of the key.
        Parameters:
        Remove - Explicit H atoms?
        Returns:
        A DataCell containing the SMILES representation of the Key.
        See Also:
        getKeyAsString(boolean)
